title: Inoculating Grain Spawn from Midwest Grow Kits - Bulk Growing Series (pt. 1)

tasks.task: Cultivate mushrooms using a spore syringe in a modified plastic bin (monotub).
subtasks: Gather necessary materials (spawn bags, spore syringe, gloves, mask, alcohol wipes, lighter).
Sterilize workspace by closing vents, windows, and doors; wipe surfaces with 70% isopropyl alcohol.
Carefully open spawn bag by unrolling tape and making small cuts without puncturing the plastic.
Prepare spore syringe by shaking to disperse spores, removing needle, sterilizing syringe cap, and flaming the needle.
Dispense 3-5 cc spore solution evenly across the surface, sides, and center of the grain mixture in the spawn bag.
Seal the needle opening with an alcohol wipe after each spawn bag inoculation.
Incubate inoculated spawn bags in a warm, undisturbed area (74-78°F) for 4-6 weeks, maintaining CO2 levels by occasionally opening the container.

tasks.task: Handle contaminated spawn bag to demonstrate potential issues.
subtasks: Identify visual signs of contamination (bright discoloration, chalky texture) in a spawn bag.
Reflect on the importance of a sterile environment in mushroom cultivation due to past missed precautions (e.g., open-air inoculation, unsealed vents).
Acknowledge the role of proper workspace preparation (closed rooms, alcohol wipes) in preventing contamination.
